meanings.definition: Of or relating to a node.
meanings.sent1: The network technician identified the nodal points for the new server connections.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the nodal properties of the network structure.
meanings.sent3: The nodal pattern on the fabric looked like tiny stars scattered across the material.
meanings.sent4: The nodal relationship between the two variables was crucial for understanding the data.
meanings.sent5: The nodal connection between the two systems was essential for data transfer.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or located at a node.
meanings.sent1: The nodal point in the map marked the center of the city.
meanings.sent2: The nodal region served as a meeting point for travelers.
meanings.sent3: The nodal position of the sculpture made it a focal point in the gallery.
meanings.sent4: The nodal location of the bus stop made it convenient for commuters.
meanings.sent5: The nodal area in the park was bustling with activity.

meanings.sent1: The nodal network allowed for efficient communication between all devices.
meanings.sent2: The nodal structure of the plant's roots provided stability in the soil.
meanings.sent3: The nodal arrangement of the chairs created a unique seating pattern.
meanings.sent4: The nodal system of the organization ensured smooth coordination among departments.
meanings.sent5: The nodal design of the building incorporated multiple meeting points.
